I have a question regarding the second rule (specifically "you must include at least one League of Legends champion"). Now, when using the term "champion" does that explicitly mean only characters that are playable in-game, or can significant characters from the lore (such as Keiran or Boram Darkwill [mentioned in Alistar's lore] or Akunir and/or Coll [mentioned in Xayah and Rakan's stories]) be used instead? I have an idea of something I'd like to do, but need this clarification so I actually know what I'm doing.

Hey Heartvine! This question has popped up a couple of times so I've just made a quick update to the ruleset, so it now says 'must feature at least one League of Legends character' instead of 'champion'. Hopefully that gives you the flexibility you need!

Ultimately this rule is in place so that everyone creates stories that are clearly set in the League of Legends universe - eg. I can't write a piece of Final Fantasy VIII fanfiction and then namedrop the Void to make it count! Strong entries for these contests usually have clear ties to Runeterra or one of the alternate universes like Star Guardians, and would be clearly recognisable as League-related to the average player.

Sounds great! This does indeed give me the flexibility I need for what I have in mind.

I wont say too much as I don't want to give it away, but the character I have in mind is a prominent aspect of the history of a particular champion (or two), and, as I understand it, I'll be exploring certain concepts that aren't really covered in the many bios and stories that already exist.

Here's hoping I do well.

Hey Chikorita, this is a great question!

Ultimately this is a writing contest and entries will be judged purely on the written content - ie. there wouldn't be 'points' deducted or added for having an art component. Prizing would accordingly go to the writer. That said, if you'd like to partner with a writer and create art based on their work, feel free to do so (and the writer is welcome to split the prizing with you if they'd like)!

I'm always excited to see anything you create  - but this contest is just giving the community's writers a turn in the spotlight, now that we've done a few art contests in a row. ;)

I gotta ask before I think it's finished, is the dismembering of voidlings in a combatant setting considered M? Or is that more of a MA setting? And since I'm on the subject, would the stabbing of another void creature be considered MA as well?
{{item:3513}}

The Australian classification description of M is [here](http://www.classification.gov.au/Guidelines/Pages/M.aspx) but ultimately think about the sort of thing you'd be cool with someone under 15 reading. Movies like the Avengers are M-rated so think about how violence is depicted there!

In writing, for me it's usually more about the way an act is described, since it's all up to how the reader visualises a scene. Cutting someone's arm off is fine, but maybe if you're getting really _really_ gory and visceral about the way you describe the blood and bone shards and whatever, you're getting a little closer to the line. It's definitely a bit up for interpretation, though!

Oh, I have been waiting for this for a very long time... So, how many league characters can I kill off before it becomes too gorey for an M rating? 
{{sticker:sg-jinx}}

Lol. I also like kill off well-known characters for the fun of it.

But I always get told off about it.{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

I don't think it's wrong or bad to kill off any number of characters, as long as it makes sense in the context of the story! 

If you want to be careful about how specific to be with describing violence and gore - ultimately as long as it's within the M rating you should be fine, but you can always use the Universe stories as guidelines - they're pretty safe. :)
Whelp time to find out what the M rating outlines! Thank you :)

A quick guideline would be (ripped straight from the aus gov website + retail know how):

Contains content of a moderate impact and is recommended for teenagers aged 15 years and over as an advisory (recommended but not legally binding like the MA 15 is).

May include classifiable elements such as violence and nudity of moderate impact - So basically it can be mildly suggestive but not explicit for sexual content, violence pretty much same deal though you can get away with a bit more detail so long as you aren't describing anything too extreme

As an example SW Battlefront (M) has death and violence but no blood or gore, AC:O (MA) has the blood and gore. Writing is a little more lax when it comes to rating because it isn't a visual representation.

Generally I wouldn't recommend taking the sexual or violent content any further than that present in Evelynn or Sion's lore: 
https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_AU/story/evelynn-color-story/
https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_AU/story/sion-color-story/
